interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: OZNaturals Anti Aging 2.5 Retinol Serum, 30 ml (1 Fl Oz) Review Date: 2017/08/28 Store: OZ Naturals Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Brand': 'OZ Naturals', 'Scent': 'Fragrance Free', 'Item Form': 'Oil', 'Active Ingredients': 'Vitamin e', 'Unit Count': '1 Fl Oz', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '1.25 x 1.25 x 4 inches; 1 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'OZ-SE-PR-1009', 'UPC': '816457020108', 'Manufacturer': 'OZ Naturals'} Review Text: Oz Naturals is a favorite go-to of mine for beauty products. I have tried many of their moisturizers, serums, and facial cleansers and am never disappointed.

This is a one ounce glass bottle, pump action. Clear serum.

Though I can't know what it does on a cellular level, really, I do know that using Oz products (along with other good skin care products and eating healthfully, along with exercise and good sleep, and genes - really, the stuff we put on our faces is only a part of good skin care) keeps my skin looking good. Many people can't tell my age, and that means I'm doing something right. So since Oz Naturals is also reasonably priced (under $18 at time of this reveiw), I feel good about purchasing it.

What I wish is that it were easier to pump - it kind of jets out so it's more difficult to control how much you want.

This is not a "luxe feel" type of serum, so be aware of that. It feels more dry (though not drying to your skin-there's just no sits-on-top-of-skin thicker feel that some serums have) after you put it on rather than with that emollient feeling some serums have. That's probably also because of the hydraulic acid quality in it. It's a serum blend of hydraulic acid, vitamin E, retinol, and other ingredients.

I use this at night, applying it to my cleansed face. I wait a few minutes and then I apply my moisturizer.

Love their product; love their company. Review Title: Oz Naturals makes great products. Rating: 4.0 --------------------------------------------------
reference_summary:
OZNaturals Anti Aging 2.5 Retinol Serum, 30 ml (1 Fl Oz) OZ Naturals {'Brand': 'OZ Naturals', 'Scent': 'Fragrance Free', 'Item Form': 'Oil', 'Active Ingredients': 'Vitamin e', 'Unit Count': '1 Fl Oz', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '1.25 x 1.25 x 4 inches; 1 Ounces', 'Item model number': 'OZ-SE-PR-1009', 'UPC': '816457020108', 'Manufacturer': 'OZ Naturals'} Oz Naturals is a favorite go-to of mine for beauty products. I have tried many of their moisturizers, serums, and facial cleansers and am never disappointed.

This is a one ounce glass bottle, pump action. Clear serum.

Though I can't know what it does on a cellular level, really, I do know that using Oz products (along with other good skin care products and eating healthfully, along with exercise and good sleep, and genes - really, the stuff we put on our faces is only a part of good skin care) keeps my skin looking good. Many people can't tell my age, and that means I'm doing something right. So since Oz Naturals is also reasonably priced (under $18 at time of this reveiw), I feel good about purchasing it.

What I wish is that it were easier to pump - it kind of jets out so it's more difficult to control how much you want.

This is not a "luxe feel" type of serum, so be aware of that. It feels more dry (though not drying to your skin-there's just no sits-on-top-of-skin thicker feel that some serums have) after you put it on rather than with that emollient feeling some serums have. That's probably also because of the hydraulic acid quality in it. It's a serum blend of hydraulic acid, vitamin E, retinol, and other ingredients.

I use this at night, applying it to my cleansed face. I wait a few minutes and then I apply my moisturizer.

Love their product; love their company. Oz Naturals makes great products.
profile:
**User Summary:**

- **Brand Preference**: Strong affinity for OZ Naturals, consistently choosing their skincare products, which suggests trust in the brand's quality and effectiveness.
  
- **Product Type**: Prefers serums and moisturizers, indicating a focus on anti-aging and skin health. Enjoys products that offer specialized benefits (e.g., retinol, hyaluronic acid).

- **Formulation**: Values fragrance-free options and prefers lightweight textures over heavy, greasy formulations, indicating a preference for comfort and wearability.

- **Quality vs. Price**: Looks for reasonably priced products without compromising quality, appreciating value for money. Indicates that budget considerations are important.

- **Application Routine**: Incorporates a structured nighttime routine, applying serums after cleansing, highlighting a commitment to skincare discipline.

- **Impact Awareness**: Acknowledges the multifaceted nature of skincare, recognizing that lifestyle factors (diet, exercise, sleep) also play a role in skin health.

- **User Experience**: Prefers products that are easy to use, expressing some frustration with pump dispensers that lack precision, indicating a desire for practicality in product design.

Overall, this user exhibits a well-rounded approach to skincare, focusing on effective, budget-friendly solutions while maintaining a disciplined routine.
